intro: Calandrinia acaulis var. graminifolia, commonly known as the grassy calandrinia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces vibrant red or purple flowers. The plant has fleshy, succulent-like leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
